text: The Violin Concerto in D major, Op. 35 is a work for solo violin and orchestra. It was written by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky in 1878. It was first performed in Vienna, Austria, on 4 December 1881.Woodstra, p. 1390 John Warrack writes, "Both the principal themes of [the] first movement are tender and eloquent ... With the Canzonetta that replaced the original Andante [Tchaikovsky] turns towards pure song ... the Finale [is] a cheerful little folk-like theme."Warrack, p. 147 ==Notes== ==References== * Warrack, John. 1973. Tchaikovsky. Charles Scribner's Sons. . * Woodstra, Chris, et al. 2005. All Music Guide to Classical Music. All Media Guide, LLC. . Category:Compositions by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky Tchaikovsky Category:Compositions in D major
title: Violin Concerto (Tchaikovsky)
